modules.name: Control.Coroutine
modules.comments:
This module defines types and functions for working with coroutines.
Coroutines are defined based on some underlying functor, which means that
the same machinery can be used for coroutines which emit values, await values,
fork, join, or any combination.

declarations.comments:
A coroutine whose commands are given by the functor `f`, with side effects
at each step given by the monad `m`.
declarations.title: Co

declarations.comments: A `Process` is a `Co`routine which only has side effects, and supports no commands.
declarations.title: Process

declarations.comments: Loop until the computation returns a `Just`.
declarations.title: loop

declarations.comments: Run a `Process` to completion.
declarations.title: runProcess

declarations.comments: Fuse two `Co`routines.
declarations.title: fuseWith

declarations.comments: Fuse two `Co`routines with a bias to the left.
declarations.title: fuseWithL

declarations.comments: A generating functor for emitting output values.
declarations.title: Emit

declarations.comments: A type synonym for a `Co`routine which only emits values.
declarations.title: Producer

declarations.comments: Emit an output value.
declarations.title: emit

declarations.comments:
Create a `Producer` by providing a monadic function that produces values.

The function should return a value of type `r` at most once, when the
`Producer` is ready to close.
declarations.title: producer

declarations.comments: A generating functor for awaiting input values.
declarations.title: Await

declarations.comments: A type synonym for a `Co`routine which only awaits values.
declarations.title: Consumer

declarations.comments: Await an input value.
declarations.title: await

declarations.comments:
Create a `Consumer` by providing a handler function which consumes values.

The handler function should return a value of type `r` at most once, when the
`Consumer` is ready to close.
declarations.title: consumer

declarations.comments: A generating functor for transforming input values into output values.
declarations.title: Transform

declarations.comments: A type synonym for a `Co`routine which transforms values.
declarations.title: Transformer

declarations.comments: Transform input values.
declarations.title: transform

declarations.comments: A generating functor which yields a value before waiting for an input.
declarations.title: CoTransform

declarations.comments:
A type synonym for a `Co`routine which "cotransforms" values, emitting an output
before waiting for its input.
declarations.title: CoTransformer

declarations.comments: Cotransform input values.
declarations.title: cotransform

declarations.comments: Transform a `CoTransformer` on the left.
declarations.title: transformCoTransformL

declarations.comments: Transform a `CoTransformer` on the right.
declarations.title: transformCoTransformR

declarations.comments: Fuse a transformer and a cotransformer.
declarations.title: fuseCoTransform

declarations.comments: Connect a producer and a consumer.
declarations.title: connect

declarations.comments:
Connect a producer and a consumer so that the consumer pulls from the
producer. This means the process ends immediately when the consumer closes.
declarations.title: pullFrom

declarations.comments: Transform a producer.
declarations.title: transformProducer

declarations.comments: Transform a consumer.
declarations.title: transformConsumer

declarations.comments: Compose transformers
declarations.title: composeTransformers

declarations.comments: Compose cotransformers
declarations.title: composeCoTransformers

declarations.comments: Run two producers together.
declarations.title: joinProducers

declarations.comments: Run two consumers together
declarations.title: joinConsumers
